title: SMB exposed on port 445
description: SMB is reachable from the scan source. Exposed SMB often increases lateral movement risk.
remediation: Restrict SMB to trusted hosts, disable SMBv1, and keep the service patched.

title: RDP exposed on port 3389
description: RDP is reachable from the scan source. Exposed RDP can enable brute force or credential abuse.
remediation: Restrict RDP access, enforce MFA, and monitor authentication attempts.

title: Telnet exposed on port 23
description: Telnet provides unencrypted remote access and should not be exposed.
remediation: Disable Telnet and use SSH with strong authentication.

title: FTP exposed on port 21
description: FTP provides unencrypted file transfer and may expose credentials.
remediation: Disable FTP or replace with SFTP/FTPS and restrict access.

title: SSH exposed on port 22
description: SSH is reachable from the scan source. Exposure increases the authentication attack surface.
remediation: Restrict SSH access, enforce key-based auth, and disable root login.

title: SMTP exposed on port 25
description: SMTP exposure can enable abuse or relay attempts if misconfigured.
remediation: Restrict SMTP to trusted networks and disable open relay.

title: DNS exposed on port 53
description: DNS exposure may leak infrastructure details if recursion is open.
remediation: Restrict recursion and limit DNS to trusted clients.

title: POP3 exposed on port 110
description: POP3 exposure can reveal credentials if not secured.
remediation: Disable POP3 or enforce TLS and strong auth.

title: IMAP exposed on port 143
description: IMAP exposure can reveal credentials if not secured.
remediation: Enforce TLS and strong authentication.

title: LDAP exposed on port 389
description: LDAP exposure may allow directory enumeration.
remediation: Restrict LDAP access and enforce authentication.

title: HTTP exposed on port 80
description: HTTP is reachable from the scan source. Review authentication and patch levels.
remediation: Harden HTTP services and ensure they are patched.

title: HTTPS exposed on port 443
description: HTTPS is reachable from the scan source. Review authentication and patch levels.
remediation: Harden HTTPS services and ensure they are patched.

title: MySQL exposed on port 3306
description: Database services exposed to untrusted networks are high-value targets.
remediation: Restrict access to database services and enforce strong auth.

title: PostgreSQL exposed on port 5432
description: Database services exposed to untrusted networks are high-value targets.
remediation: Restrict access to database services and enforce strong auth.

title: Redis exposed on port 6379
description: Redis is reachable and often misconfigured without authentication.
remediation: Bind Redis to trusted interfaces and require authentication.

title: MongoDB exposed on port 27017
description: MongoDB is reachable and may be exposed without authentication.
remediation: Bind MongoDB to trusted interfaces and enable authentication.

title: SNMP exposed on port 161
description: SNMP exposure can leak sensitive configuration data.
remediation: Restrict SNMP, enforce SNMPv3, and rotate community strings.

title: VNC exposed on port 5900
description: VNC exposure can allow remote access attempts.
remediation: Restrict VNC to trusted networks and enforce strong auth.

title: WinRM exposed on port 5985
description: WinRM exposure increases remote management attack surface.
remediation: Restrict WinRM to trusted hosts and enforce strong auth.

title: NFS exposed on port 2049
description: NFS exposure can lead to unauthorized file access if misconfigured.
remediation: Restrict NFS to trusted networks and enforce export controls.

title: Docker API exposed on port 2375
description: Unauthenticated Docker API exposure can allow container control.
remediation: Disable unauthenticated Docker API and restrict access.

title: Docker API TLS port exposed on 2376
description: Docker API TLS exposure should be restricted to trusted clients.
remediation: Restrict Docker API TLS access to trusted networks.

title: Memcached exposed on port 11211
description: Memcached exposure can leak cached data or be abused for amplification.
remediation: Bind Memcached to trusted interfaces and restrict access.

title: Elasticsearch exposed on port 9200
description: Elasticsearch exposure can lead to data access if not secured.
remediation: Restrict access and enable authentication.

title: Kibana exposed on port 5601
description: Kibana exposure can leak dashboards or data if not secured.
remediation: Restrict access and enable authentication.
